name: TDS
desc: TDS (Total Dissolved Solids) sensor values are typically measured in ppm (parts per million) and indicate the concentration of dissolved ions in water.

name: Temperature F
desc: This table organizes everyday temperatures into seven intuitive bands—from "Very Cold" to "Very Hot"—with approximate Fahrenheit and Celsius ranges and corresponding color codes that visually reflect their thermal feel.

bans.label: Very Cold
bans.desc: Freezing conditions; heavy winter clothing is essential.

bans.label: Cold
bans.desc: Chilly; a warm jacket and layers are advisable.

bans.label: Cool
bans.desc: Refreshing and brisk; a light jacket may be sufficient.

bans.label: Mild
bans.desc: Comfortable and pleasant; minimal layers needed.

bans.label: Warm
bans.desc: Pleasantly warm; typical for short sleeves and light clothing.

bans.label: Hot
bans.desc: Noticeably warm; cooling measures may be needed.

bans.label: Very Hot
bans.desc: High temperatures; heat warnings and precautions are advised.

name: Relative Humidity
desc: A five-band humidity table based on common perceptions of how relative humidity feels

bans.label: Very Dry
bans.desc: Air feels extremely dry, often causing discomfort such as dry skin and increased static electricity.

bans.label: Dry
bans.desc: Noticeably dry air; while some may find it refreshing, it can still lead to mild dryness.

bans.label: Comfortable
bans.desc: Ideal moisture level for comfort, helping maintain skin hydration without feeling sticky.

bans.label: Humid
bans.desc: Air feels noticeably moist, which can lead to a sticky sensation and reduced evaporation from the skin.

bans.label: Very Humid
bans.desc: Extremely high moisture levels; the air feels heavy and can contribute to discomfort and overheating.

name: Soil Humidity
desc: A five-band table for soil humidity levels—measured as volumetric water content—that can help farmers gauge how dry or wet their soil is for crop growth. Keep in mind these ranges are approximate and may vary with soil type and crop needs.

bans.label: Very Dry
bans.desc: Extremely dry soil; immediate irrigation is critical to avoid crop stress.

bans.label: Dry
bans.desc: Dry conditions; soil moisture is below optimal levels, so additional water is needed soon.

bans.label: Optimal
bans.desc: Ideal moisture for most crops; supports healthy root development and nutrient uptake.

bans.label: Wet
bans.desc: Wet soil; excess moisture may lead to reduced oxygen availability for roots and potential disease.

bans.label: Waterlogged
bans.desc: Saturated conditions; drainage improvement is necessary to prevent root rot and crop damage.
